results.title: Planning your career (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Everybody’s business: management in action (NP)”.
In many organisations, preparation for people to assume management positions is often poor and unstructured. While people should undertake career planning, organisations should also encourage career development skills. This episode focuses on two case studies of cadet mangement programs operating at the ANZ Bank and Coles Myer.

results.title: Planning metrication
results.creator_credit: Stanley Marks, Stephen Cross and New Decade Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Keys to Metrication”.
The success of metrication depends on careful planning to keep companies in step with their suppliers and customers, and to keep company departments in step with one another. How to start and organise the changeover, aspects of phasing, control and costs, staff familiarisation and training; the importance of timing and of using the opportunity for rationalisation which metrication offers to large and small concerns.

results.title: Planning for survival: world conservation strategy
results.brief_description: In 1980, a document on the World Conservation Strategy was published which identified goals to be implemented if the world was to survive. This video presentation outlines each goal and suggests solutions. Presents teachers with a good biological model. No other credits available.

results.title: Planning for school effectiveness: program budgeting
results.brief_description: Explains school-based program budgeting using detailed examples of the highly effective approach at Rosebery District High School, Tasmania. Considers policy making and planning community and staff involvement, management of conflict, building consensus, and evaluation. No other credits available.

results.title: Planning for personal and professional growth
results.creator_credit: George L. George, Sturgis-Grant Productions and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Planning for Teaching”.
Shows how teachers need to maintain their own mental growth and resilience to make the most of teaching. Dramatises cases of four typical teachers to explain how a teacher can avoid failure and frustration, and give inspiration instead of boredom to their charges. Stresses that teachers need to make conscious effort to deepen their understanding.

results.title: Planning and laying out work

results.brief_description: A number of dramatised incidents emphasise the importance of careful planning before starting a job; the serious results of poor planning, or no planning at all, are demonstrated.
